q: Why did I sign up for this?" she said, dropping her head on the table-- was a sweet element to the first episode, and she did manage to toughen up as the show progressed. It sounds like you're singing in a voice that's not your voice, she said, putting her finger on just one of the problems with the nerdy, "burping guy." "Idol's" far more troubling task was replacing the face of the show, Simon Cowell

the year- has confirmed while he will definitely take part in the UK series, he is worried about the logistics of jetting across the Atlantic each week. He told US TV show "Extra': We're in the process of building a rocket and it is literally going to fly us from Los Angeles to London in an hour. It hasn't been tested yet but that's the idea. he was a massive part of the show's identity. Moreover, says Slezak, Simon Cowell was someone who could deliver "succinct, brutally honest and witty" critiques in an off-the-cuff fashion. Simon Cowell was the voice of the people, he says. "He had a very specific skill that not everyone can pull off. Even Ellen DeGeneres , who has been an Oscar host couldn't do it-- and that was a shock to me."

instead being trumpeted as some sort of hero of transformation. It is truly sickening. I am one person who will never forget. I know I am not alone. In the words of Mahatma Gandhi , The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated. I voted for Mr. Barack Obama to lead this nation out of the failures of the Bush years and into greatness. His embracing of Mr. Michael Vick does nothing to advance that goal. for Life on Monday, Michele Bachmann is set to keynote the event's dinner tonight, and former Rick Santorum joined marchers in the cold-the only three potential Republican 2012 presidential hopefuls to appear at the annual gathering. Our economy is struggling and our national government is awash in a sea of debt. Amidst these struggles, some would have us focus our energies on jobs and spending, Mike Pence , an Indiana Republican, told the thousands of activists who gathered in Washington to march to the Supreme Court to protest the 38th anniversary of Roe vs. Wade. Google will take its eye off the Google Apps enterprise movement with Page in charge, given his penchant for prioritizing search engines, YouTube, and the Chrome browser and OS over enterprise software and services. If Google lets Google Apps languish, even a little bit, it only benefits Microsoft, says Roger Kay .
